result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P Berczyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (>$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not done; collected by DOC out of up to 25% prision fund and wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

12-23-2020/ Judge Milton Childs  
The Court ordered that the defendant's previously imposed sentence is modified to twelve (12) months of initial confinement and twelve (12) months of extended supervision.
It is further ordered that such modification is a TIME SERVED disposition and the defendant shall be released from custody.
****

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving six (6) months Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Menards in Milwaukee County.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3.5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1.5 years with credit for 9 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Menards in Milwaukee County.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison fund and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 6 months initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COJNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   PSI was ordered.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $750.00 To Behavioral Consultants Inc Dr Deborah Collins for services on 09-15,22,23-2015.Copy in file.

Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for doctor's report return.  The report states, to a reasonable degree of professional certainty that there is not support for defendant's plea.  Defendant has no additional information to provide to the Court.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dendant has medical records on his person that he was going to deliver to Dr. Collins after today's proceedings.  The Court ordered defense counsel to make sure he was the one to give those documents to Dr. Collins.  Defense counsel also informed the Court that there was an additional record that would be delivered by October 16, 2015.  The court advised parties if there was any issues that needed to be addressed before the next scheduled hearing, to contact the Court to schedule a hearing.    Case remains calendared for Doctor's report return on November 2, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
